#Text=United States Army suspends ammo contract for Afghan security forces
#Text=Friday , March 28 , 2008

#Text=The United States Army has suspended its contract with a company that delivered old and corroding ammunition from China for use by Afghan army and police forces in a way that violated the contract terms .
#Text=The ammunition was supplied by the Miami -based AEY Inc. , a company run by a 22-year old named Efrain Diveroli .
#Text=The nearly US$ 300 million contract stated that bullets were coming from Hungary , but were actually decades-old , damaged and corroded bullets from China .
#Text=Officials from the Army Legal Services Agency notified Diveroli , via a letter , that his company is suspended from future contracting with any U.S. government agency .
#Text=The letter came as part of an Army investigation since November regarding violation of the contract .

#Text=According to the New York Times , Diveroli signed papers back on November 25 , 2007 certifying that 28 pallets of ammunition for Afghanistan had been manufactured by MFS 2000 , a Hungarian company , according to a memo written by investigators .

#Text=AEY violated the contract by breaking two clauses , one stating that the ammunition could not be acquired directly or indirectly from the People ’s Republic of China , which is a violation of American law .
#Text=The other clause specified that it must be packaged to comply with best commercial practices for international shipment .
#Text=According to the Times , says the ammunition arrived in decomposing cardboard boxes which contained ammunition dating as far back as 1966 .
#Text=However , Army officials believe some ammunition even dates back further to 1962 .

#Text=The Army had contracted with AEY in January 2007 to supply various types of nonstandard ammunition for use by the Afghan National Army and Afghan National Police , an Army official said on background .
#Text=The company was required to purchase the ammunition and deliver it to Kabul International Airport in Afghanistan .
#Text=AEY was recently awarded a delivery order amount of $ 48,717,553 on March 17 , 2007 as part of the $ 298,004,398 contract .

#Text=Also according to the Times , when purchasing the ammunition , AEY worked with middlemen and a shell company which has been placed on federal list of entities suspected of illegal arms trafficking .
#Text=Also , the Times reported that , Diveroli was secretly recorded in conversation that suggested corruption on his company 's purchase of 100 million aging rounds from Albania .

#Text=Bryan Whitman , The Pentagon 's spokesperson told reporters that suspension of the contract was due to the violation of the origin of the ammunition and the packaging of the ammunition , not the safety and performance .
#Text=“ Safety and performance has not apparently been a factor , according to our folks in Afghanistan .
#Text=They have had no safety incidents reported and no reports of any ammunition that has malfunctioned associated with this particular contract , ” Whitman told the press .
#Text=He also denied that the issue happened because the Army awarded the contract to the lowest bidder and that he was not aware of AEY 's qualifications to fulfill the contract .
#Text=“
#Text=As the United States government does business , they are obviously always trying to ensure they get the best value , ” he said .
#Text=“ But that does not mean that , in achieving the best value for the taxpayer , that we will accept something that is below standard for what it is we are purchasing , either . ”
#Text=I would prefer he became a nice Jewish doctor or lawyer rather than an arms dealer .
#Text=He 's never asked for my approval on the company .
#Text=He does n't always take my advice , I do n't influence him .
#Text=As a father of a boy genius he 's hard to control .
#Text=—
#Text=Michael Diveroli , Efrain 's father
#Text=According to an Army official , the suspension of the contract will not have an impact on Afghanistan operations and other contractors are expressing interest into entering into a contract .
#Text=“ Besides , there ’s no shortage of ammunition already in Afghanistan .
#Text=This will have no impact , " he said .

#Text=Michael Diveroli , Efrain 's father , who originally founded AEY as a small printing business , said of his son 's career choice to CBS ' Miami affiliate , WFOR ,  I would prefer he became a nice Jewish doctor or lawyer rather than an arms dealer .

_	_	_	_

#Text=Angelo Diveroli , Efrain 's grandfather said the young man frequently accompanied him to gun shows when he was younger and became an expert at weapons .
